nodes.content: Cartonama is a conference about geospatial data, technology, applications and the overarching aspects of mobility and the community around it.
nodes.title: Cartonama Conference

nodes.content: Location-based services are the new favorites on the apps market. Find out what it takes to build the best location based service while understanding mobility, reliability, privacy and resources.
nodes.name: about-applications
nodes.title: Applications

nodes.content: The Centre for Internet and Society (CIS) is a Bangalore-based independent, non-profit research organisation. CIS is primarily involved in research on the Internet and its relationship to society. Through its academic and research programmes, campaigns, and advocacy, CIS brings together scholars, academics, students, programmers and scientists to engage in a large variety of issues concerning the Internet: from histories of the Internet to enhancing accessibility for persons with disabilities, openness, telecom and Internet governance, among others.
nodes.name: about-cis
nodes.title: About CIS

nodes.content: Geographic data sources have grown big in size, quality and coverage. Understand the standards, quality and legality, licensing, business and strategy behind the variety of data sources available in the market.
nodes.name: about-data
nodes.title: Data

nodes.content:
HasGeek is a developer-led, focused initiative, and has been un-organising the conference scene since 2010. 

We are attempting to build a new space, one that is genuinely respectful of the communities and topics that we choose to engage with. We want to be a space for developers who are excited about technology [new, uknown, mainstream] and the possibilities that it creates.

We are community-driven — check out our speaker-selection funnel, where you decide what talks to listen to by voting up or down. 

HasGeek reaches out to a wide audience of developers, entrepreneurs and students, across large and small Indian cities, by addressing interesting technology problems such as UI Engineering, Data Science and Developing for the Mobile Web, among others.

We are doing this because this is what we love: bringing a whole bunch of us geeks together, sharing our interests and expertise and hanging out later.
nodes.name: about-hasgeek
nodes.title: About HasGeek

nodes.content: Choosing the right tools is critical for the success of the product. Identify, discuss and debate the array of cartographic techniques,  geo-visualization frameworks, and developer tools.
nodes.name: about-technology
nodes.title: Technology

nodes.content:
Join Bill Morris and other map data enthusiasts in a Google Hangout tonight at 7:30pm IST, 28 August 2012.

Bill is principal at GeoSprocket LLC, a multifaceted geospatial consulting firm. With over a decade of experience in geographic information science, remote sensing and cartography, he focuses on applying the strength of spatial relationships to real-world challenges in the areas of environmental resource conservation, agricultural management and international development.

Join the Hangout directly and post your questions in live chat or if you don't have a Google+ account you can watch the Hangout live on YouTube.
nodes.description: Cartonama presents a Google Hangout with Bill Morris of GeoSprocket to talk about "all things maps."
nodes.name: hangout-with-bill-morris
nodes.title: Hangout with Bill Morris

nodes.content: Sessions at Cartonama are picked by public vote, with additional weightage from the editorial panel. Your vote counts. Please review these proposals and vote up the sessions you’d like to attend. Interested in speaking? Submit a proposal.
nodes.name: proposals
nodes.title: Session proposals

nodes.content:
HasGeek events are community-powered. You are invited to submit a session proposal, and you get to influence the proposals that make it to the schedule by voting for them in the funnel.

Submissions close 2nd September.
nodes.name: proposals-blurb
nodes.title: Confirmed sessions

nodes.content:
This event is participant-supported. Your ticket money helps cover the cost of running the event and ensures that you are our highest priority at all times. 

Ticket prices will go up as the event dates get closer, so buy today to get the best price.

If your employer is paying for your ticket, we encourage you to get a corporate ticket. These are billed directly to your employer and the extra money is used to cover travel and accommodation for speakers who don’t live in Bangalore. Your support will be acknowledged at the event. Please write to us at info@hasgeek.com for details.

Our privacy policy: We will never share your details without your explicit approval. All offers from partners and sponsors require you to accept them.

We’ll give you an NFC-enabled badge at the event. If you meet a sponsor with an interesting proposition, tap your badge on their ContactPoint reader to share contact information. It’s easy, painless, and leaves you in full control of whom you share your details with.

Cancelling your tickets: If you need to cancel your ticket please email info@hasgeek.com with the Order ID you received and the name of the attendee.
nodes.name: register
nodes.title: Register for Cartonama

nodes.content: Below is the schedule of this edition of Cartonama.
nodes.name: schedule
nodes.title: Schedule

nodes.content:
We are a bunch of "Super Coders", "Geeks" and "Rockstars", with a fire inside to make a dent in the universe. We see this world in bits and bytes and know no limits to human potential. We are driven by the passion of making awesome solutions for society and civilization through programming.

We speak PHP, Java and ErLang; live in distributed system, play with message queues and clusters. Want to know more?  Get in touch!
nodes.name: sponsor-commonfloor
nodes.title: CommonFloor

nodes.content:
In case you're new to it, a Twitter hashtag chat is a fun, easy way to talk with people across the world on an interesting topic. All you do is use the same hashtag in your tweets and follow along in your browser or client of choice. We're going to be using  the tag #cartonama for today's chat.

Henry Addo will be joining us in chat today to talk about the state of crowd sourced tools and projects in the mapping and location data ecosystem. Henry is a software developer living in Accra, Ghana. He has worked as a software developer with several IT companies including Suuch Solutions, txtGhana, IDZ Ghana limited. Currently, Henry works at Ushahidi, a non-profit tech company that specializes in developing free and open source software for information collection, visualization and interactive mapping.

He is passionate about open technologies and has been instrumental in the evangelism and advocacy of the use of Free and Open Source Software in Ghana.
nodes.description: Join us on for a Twitter hashtag chat with Henry Addo of Ushahidi about the state of crowd sourced tools and projects.
nodes.name: twitter-hashtag-henry-addo
nodes.title: Twitter hashtag chat with Henry Addo
